intro: Anaphyllopsis pinnata, commonly known as the featherleaf anemone, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. Anaphyllopsis pinnata is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
